protocol.name: Psilocybin-Assisted Therapy for Treatment-Resistant Depression
protocol.overview: Evidence-based psilocybin-assisted psychotherapy protocol based on COMP360 Phase 3 trials and Johns Hopkins University research. Integrates psychological support with controlled psilocybin administration for major depressive disorder unresponsive to at least two prior antidepressant trials.
evidence_sources: Goodwin GM, et al. N Engl J Med. 2022;387(18):1637-1648 (PMID: 36322843)
Davis AK, et al. JAMA Psychiatry. 2021;78(5):481-489 (PMID: 33146667)
Johnson MW, et al. J Psychopharmacol. 2008;22(6):603-620 (PMID: 18593734)
Carhart-Harris RL, et al. Lancet Psychiatry. 2021;8(3):203-212 (PMID: 33545078)

steps.title: Comprehensive Psychiatric Evaluation
steps.description: Detailed psychiatric assessment to confirm treatment-resistant depression diagnosis, assess eligibility, and establish baseline mental health status. Requires documented failure of at least two adequate antidepressant trials.
clinical_scales: MADRS (Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale) - Primary outcome measure

diagnostic_criteria.trd_definition: Failed at least 2 adequate trials (≥6 weeks, therapeutic dose) of antidepressants

psychiatric_history: Prior antidepressant trials with doses, durations, responses

steps.title: Medical Clearance & Safety Screening
steps.description: Comprehensive medical evaluation to identify contraindications and ensure patient safety for psilocybin administration. Focus on cardiovascular, neurological, and metabolic health.
lab_tests_required: Electrocardiogram (ECG) - especially if age >40 or cardiac risk factors
Pregnancy test (for women of childbearing potential)
medical_history_focus: Personal or family history of psychotic disorders

steps.title: Safety & Eligibility Determination
steps.description: Comprehensive evaluation of inclusion/exclusion criteria based on psychiatric and medical screening to determine patient eligibility for psilocybin-assisted therapy.

absolute_contraindications.description: Personal history of schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, or psychotic disorder
First-degree family member with schizophrenia or psychotic disorder
Bipolar I disorder with history of manic episodes
Current suicidal intent with plan or recent attempt (<6 months)
Uncontrolled hypertension (>140/90), recent MI (<6 months), unstable angina
History of seizures (except childhood febrile seizures)
Current moderate-severe substance use disorder (except tobacco, cannabis)

medication_contraindications.required_washout: Consult with psychiatrist; may need discontinuation

medication_contraindications.required_action: May attenuate psilocybin effects; consider tapering if clinically appropriate

acceptable_concomitant_medications: SSRIs/SNRIs (may reduce psilocybin effects but not contraindicated in COMP360 trial)
Benzodiazepines at stable doses (available as rescue medication)

branch_outcomes.description: Patient meets inclusion criteria, no absolute contraindications
Absolute contraindication present, refer to alternative treatments
Eligible after medication adjustment or washout period

steps.title: Preparation Session 1 - Therapeutic Alliance & Education
steps.description: First psychological preparation session focused on building therapeutic rapport, education about psilocybin effects, and setting intentions. Critical for establishing trust and safety.

therapeutic_alliance: Introduction to therapy team (primary therapist and co-facilitator)
Discussion of therapist backgrounds and approach
Patient sharing of depression history and personal story
Establishing trust and comfort with therapy team
Clarifying patient's goals and hopes for treatment
education_components: Pharmacology of psilocybin (onset, peak, duration, metabolism)
Expected psychological effects (perceptual changes, emotional intensity, ego dissolution)
Physical effects (nausea, changes in temperature perception, altered proprioception)
Role of therapists during session (non-directive support)
set_and_setting_introduction: Tour of dosing room (if not already shown)
Discussion of comfort measures (blankets, eyeshades, tissues)
addressing_concerns: Common fears (losing control, going crazy, bad trip)
Discussion of 'challenging experiences' as potentially therapeutic

homework_assigned: Journaling about depression history and turning points
Optional: listening to sample music from dosing playlist

steps.title: Preparation Session 2 - Intention Setting & Trust Surrender
steps.description: Second preparation session focused on deepening therapeutic relationship, setting specific intentions, and introducing concepts of trust, surrender, and acceptance during the psilocybin experience.

homework_review: Review journaling about depression and intentions
Discuss insights or emotions that arose
intention_setting: Articulating specific intentions for psilocybin session
Exploring what healing might look or feel like
Identifying aspects of self or life to explore
Framing intentions as open questions rather than demands
Examples: 'Help me understand my depression', 'Show me what I need to see', 'Help me feel connection again'
trust_surrender_acceptance: Philosophy of 'trusting, letting go, being open' (Johns Hopkins framework)
Discussing resistance and how to work with it
Concept of 'going toward' difficult emotions rather than avoiding
Metaphors: surfing waves, river flowing, passenger not driver
difficult_experience_preparation: Strategies: deep breathing, trusting the process, calling for therapist support
Reassurance that difficult experiences often precede breakthroughs
Discussion of physical comfort measures (removing eyeshades, sitting up, therapist holding hand)
practical_preparation: What to eat day before and morning of (light, healthy foods)
What NOT to consume (alcohol, recreational drugs)

homework_assigned: Finalizing intentions (can write down and bring to session)

steps.title: Preparation Session 3 - Final Preparation & Safety Review
steps.description: Final preparation session before dosing, reviewing practical details, finalizing intentions, addressing any remaining concerns, and reinforcing trust in the process and therapy team.

readiness_assessment: Address any new concerns or fears
Review of sleep quality, stress levels, life circumstances
Ensure patient feels supported and prepared
timeline_walkthrough: Step-by-step review of dosing day from arrival to departure
Typical timeline: onset (30-45 min), peak (2-3 hours), gradual descent (3-4 hours), return (6-8 hours total)
What therapists will be doing during session (present, observing, occasional check-ins)
When and how to request support
intention_refinement: Balancing specific goals with openness to unexpected insights
Encouraging curiosity and non-attachment to outcomes
music_and_eyeshades: Importance of music as guide for journey
Encouragement to keep eyeshades on (promotes introspection)
Permission to adjust or remove if needed
safety_review: Medical monitoring during session (vitals every 30 minutes)
Therapists remain in room entire time
Rescue medication available if needed (benzodiazepine for severe distress)
post_session_expectations: Likely feeling tired, emotionally raw, or unusually open
Importance of integration session next day
Not processing alone - saving for integration

final_checklist: Confirm dosing day logistics (arrival time, transportation)
Verify fasting instructions (no food 4 hours before, light breakfast okay)
Medication check (continue or hold current medications as directed)

steps.title: Dose Determination
steps.description: Clinical decision-making to determine optimal psilocybin dose based on patient factors, depression severity, anxiety level, prior psychedelic experience, and risk assessment. Based on COMP360 trial dosing.

comp360_dosing_framework.note: COMP360 uses synthetic psilocybin; doses not equivalent to psilocybin mushrooms

johns_hopkins_dosing_framework.note: Higher doses associated with greater mystical experience and better depression outcomes

considerations.recommendation: May need more preparation but standard dose
Consider lower initial dose (20mg) or enhanced support
Address in preparation, may reduce initial dose

dose_selection_factors.note: COMP360 used fixed dosing (not weight-based), but some protocols consider weight

considerations.consideration: Standard dose, may consider 30mg if other factors support

considerations: History of handling stress and emotions

standard_protocol.second_session_dose: Same or adjusted based on first session response
standard_protocol.third_session_dose: If needed, adjusted based on response pattern

branch_outcomes.description: Conservative initial dose for higher anxiety or first-time psychedelic use
Standard therapeutic dose based on COMP360 trial evidence
Higher dose for severe depression or experienced individuals

steps.title: Psilocybin Dosing Session (Day 0)
steps.description: Full-day supervised psilocybin administration in controlled clinical setting with continuous psychological support and medical monitoring. Duration typically 8-10 hours from arrival to discharge.

activities: Greeting and settling into dosing room
Review of intentions and any last questions
Urine drug screen (if required by protocol)
Review of comfort with therapists and setting

dosing_protocol.medication_form: Psilocybin capsules (COMP360) or synthetic psilocybin solution
co_medications: Anti-nausea medication may be offered (ondansetron 4-8mg) 30 min before
Benzodiazepine available as rescue (lorazepam 1-2mg) for severe anxiety

setting.room_design: Comfortable, living room-like with couch/bed, soft lighting, aesthetic elements
setting.music: Curated playlist (6-8 hours) - classical, world, ambient, emotionally evocative
setting.comfort_items: Eyeshades, blankets, tissues, water, fresh flowers
setting.therapist_positioning: Seated nearby, attentive but not intrusive presence

onset_phase.patient_experience: Subtle shifts in perception, possible nausea, mild anxiety or excitement
therapist_actions: Gentle reassurance and presence
Encourage patient to lie back, put on eyeshades, listen to music
Minimal verbal interaction unless patient initiates
Observe for early anxiety and provide calming presence

ascent_phase.patient_experience: Intensifying effects, visual phenomena, emotional waves, possible challenging content
therapist_actions: Maintain supportive presence
If patient shows distress: use reassuring touch (hand on shoulder), gentle words
Reminders: 'trust, let go, be open', 'go toward it, not away'
Encourage keeping eyeshades on for deeper introspection
Minimal conversation - allow internal journey

peak_phase.patient_experience: Peak intensity, possible mystical experience, ego dissolution, profound insights, emotional catharsis
therapist_actions: Remain quietly present
One therapist in room at all times, both during peak if possible
Non-directive support - mirror patient's emotional state without interpreting
If patient speaks: active listening, reflection, minimal guidance
Support bathroom breaks if needed (assist walking if unsteady)
Track any significant utterances or insights for later integration
Manage challenging experiences with calm, grounding presence
special_monitoring: Need for intervention or rescue medication
Safety awareness (patient staying on couch/bed, not leaving room)

descent_phase.patient_experience: Gradual reduction in intensity, integration of experience beginning, emotional processing
therapist_actions: Continue supportive presence
May begin gentle check-ins: 'How are you feeling?'
Allow patient to remove eyeshades when ready
Offer water, light snacks if patient interested
Begin gentle grounding (noticing room, physical sensations)
Listen to patient's initial reflections without interpretation

return_phase.patient_experience: Mostly returned to baseline, may feel tired, emotionally open, vulnerable, or peaceful
therapist_actions: Check-in conversation about experience
Ask open questions: 'What stands out?', 'How do you feel?'
Reassurance and normalization
Encourage journaling if patient feels ready
Prepare for discharge and next-day integration
Review self-care instructions for evening
discharge_criteria: Vital signs stable and near baseline

alert_parameters.action_if_abnormal: Physician evaluation, consider rescue medication or medical intervention

psychological_distress.mild_anxiety: Verbal reassurance, hand holding, grounding techniques
psychological_distress.moderate_distress: Therapist speaking directly, physical comfort, reminding of safety
psychological_distress.severe_distress: Benzodiazepine (lorazepam 1-2mg PO or IM), physician evaluation, trip-sitting until resolution

medical_emergency.procedures: Emergency medical kit available, physician on-call, protocol for 911 if needed

scales: 5D-ASC (5-Dimensional Altered States of Consciousness) - administered next day
MEQ30 (Mystical Experience Questionnaire) - administered next day

evening_instructions: Rest at home with trusted person present
Journaling if desired, but no pressure to process
Contact emergency number if any concerns
post_session_care.next_day: Integration session scheduled (typically 10-11 AM following day)

steps.title: Integration Session 1 - Day After Dosing (Day 1)
steps.description: Critical first integration session occurring 1 day after psilocybin dosing to process experience, capture insights, address emotional responses, and begin translating experience into actionable changes.

check_in: How do you feel physically and emotionally this morning?
Any lingering effects or unusual experiences?
Overall sense of the experience in retrospect?
experience_review: Challenging moments and how they were navigated
insight_identification: What did you learn or realize?
Symbols, visions, or metaphors that feel meaningful?
emotional_processing: What emotions came up during session?
meaning_making: What does this experience mean to you?
How does it relate to your depression journey?
Beginning to connect insights to daily life
mystical_experience_assessment: Discuss any spiritual or transcendent aspects
Normalize variety of experiences (mystical or psychological)
altered_states_assessment: Capture phenomenology of experience for clinical record

clinical_scales: MEQ30 (Mystical Experience Questionnaire) - predictive of outcomes
homework_assigned: Continued journaling about experience and emerging insights
Noticing any shifts in mood, perspective, or behavior
Identifying one small change to implement based on insights

steps.title: Integration Session 2 - Week 1 Post-Dosing
steps.description: Second integration session focusing on translating insights into behavioral changes, monitoring mood shifts, and supporting integration into daily life.

mood_assessment: How has your mood been this week?
Changes in energy, motivation, sleep, appetite?
behavioral_activation: Identifying concrete changes or actions from insights
Reconnecting with values and meaningful activities
social_integration: Sharing experience with others (or choosing not to)
Changes in relationships or social engagement?
Re-entry into normal life and routines

homework_assigned: Implementing one behavioral change from insights
Mindfulness or meditation practice if interested

steps.title: Integration Session 3 - Week 2 Post-Dosing
steps.description: Continued integration work with focus on sustaining changes, addressing challenges, and monitoring depression symptoms.

deeper_therapy: Using psilocybin insights for ongoing therapeutic work
Addressing core beliefs or patterns revealed

steps.title: Week 3 Assessment - Clinical Outcome Evaluation
steps.description: Comprehensive clinical assessment at 3 weeks post-dosing to evaluate treatment response and determine next steps.
clinical_scales: MADRS (primary outcome - administered by trained rater)

steps.title: Treatment Response Evaluation & Second Session Decision
steps.description: Clinical decision point to evaluate response to first psilocybin session and determine need for second dosing session. Based on COMP360 protocol which typically includes 1-3 sessions.

response_criteria.definition: MADRS reduction ≥50% from baseline OR MADRS score <10 (remission)
response_criteria.clinical_significance: Substantial improvement, depression in remission or near-remission
response_criteria.recommendation: Continue integration therapy, monitor closely, second session may not be immediately needed
Schedule second psilocybin session, continue integration
Schedule second session with possible dose adjustment, evaluate other factors

response_criteria.clinical_significance: Treatment not effective for this patient
response_criteria.recommendation: Consider alternative treatments, evaluate session quality, address barriers

timing_considerations.standard_protocol: Second session typically 3-5 weeks after first session
timing_considerations.comp360_protocol: Up to 3 sessions spaced weeks apart
timing_considerations.rationale: Allow time for integration and assessment before re-dosing

factors_affecting_decision: Quality of mystical experience (MEQ30 score - higher scores predict better outcomes)

branch_outcomes.description: Second psilocybin session recommended, return to preparation phase
Strong response, continue integration therapy without immediate re-dosing
Minimal benefit, explore other treatment options

steps.title: Ongoing Integration Sessions (Weeks 4-12)
steps.description: Weekly or bi-weekly integration therapy sessions to sustain and deepen therapeutic gains, process ongoing insights, and support behavioral changes.
steps.session_frequency: Weekly for weeks 4-8, then bi-weekly weeks 9-12 (adjust based on need)
session_focus: Processing trauma or difficult emotions revealed
Preparing for treatment end and maintenance

clinical_monitoring.purpose: Track symptom trajectory and identify early relapse signs

steps.title: End of Treatment Assessment (Week 12)
steps.description: Comprehensive end-of-protocol assessment to evaluate overall outcomes, prepare for transition to maintenance care, and celebrate progress.

symptom_outcomes: Depression severity compared to baseline and week 3

if_in_remission: Possibility of booster session if needed (6-12 months)

booster_sessions.timing: Typically not before 6 months after initial treatment

absolute_contraindications: Bipolar I disorder with manic episodes
relative_contraindications: Current SSRI use (may reduce effects but not contraindicated)

adverse_effects_monitoring.management: Intensive integration therapy, psychiatric support, possible medication

emergency_protocols.severe_psychological_distress: Benzodiazepine administration, psychiatric evaluation, possible hospitalization
emergency_protocols.medical_emergency: On-site physician, emergency medical services, hospital transfer
emergency_protocols.suicidal_crisis: Safety assessment, psychiatric hospitalization if needed, intensive follow-up

considerations: Extended preparation focusing on safety and control
Possible trauma re-experiencing during session (can be therapeutic)
May have blunted psilocybin response (serotonin receptor downregulation)
Not contraindicated in COMP360 trial (most patients were on antidepressants)
Consider higher dose or medication taper if appropriate
No serotonin syndrome risk with psilocybin

comp360_phase_3_results.durability: Effects sustained in many patients at 12 weeks
comp360_phase_3_results.comparison: Superior to 1mg control, comparable to 10mg comparator dose

johns_hopkins_findings.mystical_experience_correlation: Higher MEQ30 scores predict better depression outcomes
johns_hopkins_findings.dose_response: Higher doses (20-30mg/70kg) more likely to produce therapeutic mystical experiences
johns_hopkins_findings.long_term_outcomes: Many patients maintain improvement 6-12 months post-treatment

clinical_pearls: Therapeutic relationship quality is critical - invest in preparation phase
Music and setting profoundly influence experience - attend to details
Challenging experiences during session often lead to breakthroughs - encourage acceptance
Mystical experience quality predicts outcomes - support conditions for transcendent experience
Integration is where healing happens - don't underestimate post-session therapy
Safety screening is paramount - err on side of caution with contraindications
Set and setting cannot be overemphasized - every detail matters
